content.description: <math alttext="C u, solid, plus, 2 A g N O 3, aqueous, react to produce, C u, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous, plus, 2 A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
content.question: The reaction between solid copper and aqueous silver nitrate produces solid silver and a blue solution, as represented by the balanced equation shown above. Based on the balanced equation, which of the following identifies the oxidation and reduction half-reactions?

choices.label: Oxidation Half-reactionReduction Half-reaction<math alttext="C u, solid, produces, C u with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus one electron" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="A g with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons, produce, A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Oxidation Half-reactionReduction Half-reaction<math alttext="C u, solid, produces, C u with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mstyle><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, one electron, produce, A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Oxidation Half-reaction Reduction Half-reaction <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, one electron, produce, A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C u, solid, produces, C u with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mstyle><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Oxidation Half-reactionReduction Half-reaction<math alttext="C u, solid, produces, C u with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mstyle><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, one electron, produce, A g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
